title-group.article-title: Central Mean Subspace in Time Series

permissions.copyright-statement: © 2009 The American Statistical Association, the Institute of Mathematical Statistics, and the Interface Foundation of North America

abstract.p: We propose a notion of central mean dimension reduction subspace for time series $\{x_{t}\}$ which does not require specification of a model but seeks to find a p × d matrix $\boldsymbol{\Phi}_{d}$ , d ≤ p, so that the d × 1 vector $\boldsymbol{\Phi}_{d}^{T}{\bf X}_{t-1}$ , where ${\bf X}_{t-1}=(x_{t-1},\ldots ,x_{t-p})^{T}$ for some p ≥ 1, includes all the information about $x_{t}$ that is available from ${\rm E}(x_{t}|{\bf X}_{t-1})$ . For known p and d, we estimate the mean central subspace through the Nadaraya—Watson kernel smoother and establish the strong consistency of our estimator. In addition, we propose estimation of d and p using a modified Schwarz Bayesian criterion, if either of d and p is unknown. Finally, we examine the performance of all the estimators extensively through a variety of simulations and provide a new analysis of the well-known Canadian lynx data. Supplemental materials for this article are available online.
